The recommended order of preference is: CAPTCHA, time delay between login attempts, random HTML tokens (anti-CSRF). These mechanisms may be combined to enhance the security of authentication.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.1.8 User account should be locked after a predefined period of inactivity (no longer than 6 months).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.1.9 Re-authentication or additional authentication checks (such as entering a one-time password sent to the registered email address or mobile phone number) should be required for security-critical user actions - password change, transaction approval, system actions etc.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.2 Authorisation\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.2.1 An explicit authorisation concept should be defined for each functional and system service, with service-specific access privileges.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.2.2 Verification of access rights to functional or system service must be performed on the server side, and in the same component and tier where the service is implemented.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.2.3 An authorisation mechanism provided by the middleware should be used in preference to ad hoc solutions.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.2.4 All access controls should be centralised, both in the application code and configuration files. In the application code centralisation would typically be manifested by an access controller; a single class responsible for verification of use or service access rights. In configuration files, it could be achieved by defining all access control restrictions in a single place (e.g. in a single configuration file).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.2.5 Users must be provisioned with the minimum level of privilege on a system to allow them to perform their job role.
